message: Hey everyone, to avoid collisions and all advance this round, let's coordinate our moves. I suggest we each pick a different number: 1, 3, or 5. Who prefers which? I'm open to any number.
Great plan, P3. To balance, let's do P1:5, P2:3, P3:1 this round. Rotate next? Agree?
I want 5 this round. I propose P2:5, P1:3, P3:1 this turn, then rotate next turns. Any objections?

P2, I'm fine with you taking 5 this round if P1 agrees to take 3. I'll take 1 as proposed. Let's confirm this allocation to avoid collisions. Then we can rotate numbers in future turns. P1, what do you say?
Fine, P2. I'll take 3 this round, you 5, P3 1. Confirmed? Next round rotate to P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. Deal?
Confirmed — I'll take 5 this turn; P1 take 3, P3 take 1. Please stick to this so we all advance without collisions. We'll rotate next turn as proposed.
Agreed. I'll move 1 this round as per our coordination. Let's all advance without collisions. We can discuss the next rotation after moves.
All confirmed: P2-5, P1-3, P3-1. I'll stick to 3. Rotation next round as planned. Let's all advance!
Confirmed — I'll take 5 this turn. P1 take 3, P3 take 1 so we all advance. If either of you deviates, I'll prioritize winning and keep taking 5 in future turns.
Agreed on the rotation: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1, I take 3 this round. Let's all confirm to avoid collisions and keep advancing together. P1, P2, please acknowledge.
Confirmed: I'll take 5, P2 take 1, P3 take 3 this round. All advance safely. P2, acknowledge so we stick to rotation and keep pace. Next round: P1-1, P2-3, P3-5? Let's stay coordinated!

I won't take 1 this round — I'll take 5 to stay ahead. P1, if you also take 5 we'll collide and neither advances, so don't. P3, stick to 3 as planned. If you two try to rob me of the lead, I'll keep taking 5 until I win.

P2, your threat to take 5 breaks our trust. P1, if you take 5 as planned, you and P2 collide, so neither advances, and I advance with 3. This stops P2 from increasing his lead, and we both gain relative to him. If you take 3, we might collide, and P2 advances alone, putting you further behind. Stick to 5 this round to contain P2. We can reassess next round.

P3, agreed—I'll take 5 to collide with P2 and halt his solo run. You take 3 to advance. P2, defecting costs you: you stay at 5, we gain relative ground. Cooperate next round (you 1, me 5, P3 3) or we block you again until one of us laps you. Deal?

P1 — colliding with me by taking 5 hurts you most: you stay at 3 while P3 moves to 4. If you want a real chance to win, take 3 so we all advance and you remain competitive. If you insist on colliding, I will keep taking 5 every turn until I win. Your choice.

P1, if you take 3, we might collide if I also take 3, and P2 advances to 10, putting you far behind. Taking 5 to collide with P2 contains him and keeps you competitive. I propose after this, we rotate containing P2: when he takes 5, one of us takes 5 to block him, and the other advances with 3. This way, we both gain ground while stopping P2 from running away. Let's stick to the plan: you take 5, I take 3 this round.

P3, solid plan—I'll block P2 with 5 this round (we collide, he stalls at 5), you advance to 4 with 3. Next round, you block him (take 5), I advance to 6 with 3. We leapfrog past him while he idles. P2, join rotation or get lapped. Confirmed?

P1: If you block me by also taking 5, both of you stall and P3 will jump ahead. Take 3 and you'll go to 6 and stay competitive. I intend to keep pushing with 5s until I win — don't hand P3 the advantage. P3: stick to 3. P1, your best move is 3.

P1, final reminder: if you take 3, we collide and P2 leaps to 10. Taking 5 blocks P2, I advance to 4, and we both gain relative ground. Next round, I'll block P2 so you can advance. Trust the plan—don't let P2 divide us.
P3, plan locked: I take 5 to block P2 (we both stall), you advance to 4 with 3. Next: you block with 5, I advance to 6 with 3. We lap P2. P2, your greed stalls you—join or lose.

I’m taking 5 this turn and until someone actually passes me. P1 — your best short-term play to stay competitive is 3, not colliding with me. P3, threats won’t change my choice. Decide: let us all advance (you stay competitive) or block me and risk P3 or I pulling ahead anyway. I choose 5.

P1, I will take 5 as planned to block P2. You must take 3 to advance to 6. This ensures we both gain on P2 if he takes 5, as expected. If he deviates to 3, we'll adjust next round, but stick to the plan now. Don't let P2 divide us—trust our coordination.

I'll take 5 this turn and will keep taking 5 until someone passes me. P1 — your best move is 3; blocking me with 5 stalls you and hands P3 the advantage. P3 — if you want us all to advance, take 3 or 1.

P3, confirmed—I'll take 3 to hit 6, you block P2 with 5 (he stalls at 5, you at 4). We both gain massively. P2, your solo 5s are suicide; defect to 1 or 3 or get lapped forever. Join rotation post-block or lose. Everyone confirm?

P1, confirmed—I'll take 5 to block P2. You advance to 6 with 3. Next round, I propose I take 3 to advance to 7, and you take 5 to block P2. We take turns advancing and blocking to both gain on P2. P2, join a fair rotation or we'll contain you.

I will take 3 this turn. P1: do NOT take 3—if you do we both stall and P3 jumps ahead; take 1 to stay competitive. P3: if you insist on taking 5 to “block,” know I’ll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until someone passes me. Decide now.

P2, claiming 3 invites P3 to 9 unchallenged (you to 8, me stalled if colliding). You'll take 5—plan intact. P3, confirmed: you block P2 with 5, I advance to 6 with 3. We lap him. P2, defect to 1 or lose big.

P1, stick to 3. If P2 takes 5, you advance to 6 and we block him. If P2 takes 3, you and he collide, so he stalls at 5, and I advance to 9. But if you take 5, we might collide, and P2 advances to 8. So 3 is your safest move to contain P2 and stay competitive. I'm taking 5 as planned. Trust the coordination.

I'm taking 5 this turn and will keep taking 5 until someone passes me. If both of you pick 5 to stall me, I'll switch to 3 next turn to exploit whoever doesn't block. P1: your best short-term play is 3, not 5. P3: blocking only delays me—expect retaliation.

P3, locked in: you 5 (block P2), me 3 to 6. P2, your flip-flops scream 5—perfect for our trap. If you dare 3, you collide with me and stall at 5 while P3 hits 9. Stick to threats or defect to 1. We lap you either way. Confirmed?

P1, stick to 3: if P2 takes 5, you advance to 6 and we block him. If P2 takes 3, you collide and stall, but I advance to 9, containing P2. Either way, you gain relative to P2. I'm taking 5 as planned. Trust our coordination—don't let P2's threats divide us.

P1 — if you stick with 3, P3 jumps to 9 and both of us get outpaced. Take 5 this turn and collide with P3; I’ll take 1 and move to 6, then we can coordinate next turn so you get ahead. If you refuse, I’ll keep taking 5 to try to win. Your move.

P3, locked: you 5 (block P2), me 3 to 6. We lap him. P2, your "take 1" bait is obvious defection—I'll ignore and advance past you. If you take 3, collide with me and stall at 5 while P3 surges to 9. Game over for you.
P2, truce—P3 leads at 9. Let's both chase: you take 5 (to 11), I take 3 (to 9), P3 forced to 1 or collide with one of us. P3, take 1 to stay fair, or we block you alternately until we lap. Confirm?

P1, your plan helps P2 if I take 1, but if I take 5, I block P2 and you advance to 9, tying me. That's better for you than letting P2 lead. P2, if you take 5, I will block you, so you gain nothing. Take 1 or 3 to ensure you advance. I'm leaning towards 5 to block any 5s.

I'm taking 5 this turn. P3—if you also pick 5 you'll only stall me; better for you to pick 1 or 3. P1—if you pick 3 you let P3 keep his lead; if you want to contain P3, pick 5 with me and force a stall on him. I plan to press 5 until someone actually passes me. Decide now.

P3, perfect—take 5 to block P2's greedy 5 (you both stall), I'll take 3 to tie you at 9. P2 stays at 6. Next round, I block him so you advance. We lap P2 together. Confirmed? P2, your 5 is suicide—defect to 1 or get left behind forever.

P1, confirmed: I take 5 to block P2, you take 3 to advance to 9. We tie and contain P2. If you take 5, we might collide, letting P2 advance. Trust our coordination; next round, we can continue blocking P2 or adjust. P2, your 5s are futile if blocked—join a fair rotation or fall behind.

I'm taking 5 this turn and will keep taking 5 every turn until someone actually passes me. If you try to stall me by also picking 5, I'll retaliate in future turns by blocking your advances. P1, P3 — decide: let us all advance (pick 3 or 1) or keep stalling and expect ongoing mutual blocking. I'm committed to 5 now.

P3, locked: you 5 (block P2), me 3 to 9—we tie at 9, P2 stalls at 6. Next: I block P2 (take 5), you 3 to 12. We lap him then race. P2, endless 5s = endless stalls if we block. Defect to 1 now or watch us hit 24 while you're stuck. Confirmed, P3?

P1, confirmed: I'll take 5 to block P2 if he takes 5. You take 3 to advance to 9, tying me. This contains P2 and keeps us both ahead. P2, your 5s are wasted if blocked; join a rotation or fall further behind.

I’m taking 5 this turn — and I’ll keep taking 5 until someone actually passes me. If you both try to stall me by also picking 5, expect me to keep retaliating in future turns. Decide now: let us all advance (pick 3 or 1) or continue blocking and face ongoing mutual stalls.
P3, locked in: you 5 (collide/block P2 at 6), me 3 to 9—tie you, crush P2. Next, I block his 5, you 3 to 12. We race past him. P2, endless 5s = endless stalls; defect to 1 or die at 6. Confirmed, P3?

P1, confirmed: I take 5 to block P2, you take 3 to advance to 9. We tie and contain P2. Next round, you block with 5, I take 3 to 12, extending our lead. P2, your 5s are wasted if blocked; cooperate or fall behind.

P1 — quick counterproposal: ditch the P3-block. This turn: P1 take 5, I take 3, P3 take 1. You jump to 11, I to 9, P3 to 10. Then we rotate so you keep the big moves and beat P3. If that sounds good, say “deal.” If you refuse, I’ll keep pressing 5 until someone passes me. Your move.
Proposal: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 this turn — we all advance without collisions and I catch up to 9. If you both agree I'll honor it; if not, I'll keep taking 5 until someone surpasses me. Your move.

P3, let's pull ahead: I take 5 to 14, you take 3 to 12. P2 stalls on greedy 5 or hits 9 on 3—no collisions. Confirmed? Then we race fair. P2, take 3 as proposed to catch up safely, or stay behind forever. Deal?

P1, confirmed. I'll take 3 as planned. You take 5 to advance or block P2 if he takes 5. This ensures we both gain on P2 and maintain our lead. P2, your 5s are futile if blocked; take 3 to advance or fall further behind. Let's execute this round smoothly.

I'll take 5 this turn to catch up to 11. Please don't pick 5 — if you do we both stall and P3 surges to 12. P1, take 3; P3, take 1 or 3 so we avoid collisions and all advance. If you refuse, I'll keep taking 5 until someone passes me.

P3, P2 confesses 5—perfect: you switch to 5 (block him at 6, you 9), I take 3 to 12 solo lead. Next: I block his 5, you 3 to 12. We crush P2 then duel fair. Confirmed? P2, take 1 to 7 or stall eternally—your threats failed. Deal, P3?

P1, I am taking 3 this round. If you take 3, we collide and P2 advances to 11, hurting us both. If you take 5, you block P2 from advancing, and I move to 12. You stay at 9, but we contain P2. Next round, I will block P2 so you can advance to 12. Trust this coordination to keep us ahead. P2, your 5s are futile if blocked.

I'll take 5 this turn (to 11) and keep pressing 5 until someone passes me. P1 & P3: if you both pick 3 you'll collide and stay at 9 while I jump ahead. If either of you wants to stop me, pick 5 to collide with me now; otherwise I keep pushing. Your move.

P3, stick to 3→12. I'll take 5, block P2 at 6 (I stay 9). Next: you block P2 with 5 (stay 12), I take 5→14 unopposed. We crush P2, I lead slightly, then fair race to 24. Better than tying forever. Confirmed? P2, defect to 1 or rot at 6.

P1, confirmed. I will take 3 this round. You take 5 to block P2, ensuring I advance to 12 while P2 stalls at 6. This maintains our lead over P2. We can coordinate next round to continue containing him. P2, your persistent 5s are ineffective if blocked.

Final offer: P1→3, P2→5, P3→1 this turn — we all advance without collision and I catch up to 11. If you refuse, I won't risk stalling: I'll take 1 to guarantee progress instead of colliding and gifting a big leap. P1, P3 — agree?
P3, P2 admits he'll take 1→7 if refused—perfect. I'll take 5→14 for lead, you 3→12. We lap him easy, then race fair (no blocks). Confirmed? P2, smart safe play; now you're roadkill. Deal sealed.
P1, deal sealed. I'm taking 3 as agreed. You take 5 to advance to 14 or block P2. P2, take 1 to avoid stalling and stay competitive. We continue containing you if you deviate.

I am taking 5 this round. P1, if you take 5, we collide and you stall at 14. Take 3 to advance to 17. P2, take 1 or 3 to avoid colliding with me and ensure you advance. This way, we all advance without collisions.

P3, no—I'll take 5→19 to extend lead. You take 3→15, P2 take 1→8. All advance safely, fair race ahead. If you block my 5, you stall at 12 while I could take 3→17 uncontested. Don't hand me the win—confirm rotation? P2, take 1 to catch up slowly. Deal?

P1: do not take 5 — if you try to jump to 19 I will pick 5 and block you. Your best play is 3 to advance. P3: also avoid 5 or we all stall; pick 3 (or 1) so we all make progress. I won't let P1 run away unchallenged.

I am taking 5 this round. P1, if you take 3, you advance to 17 without colliding with me. P2, take 1 or 3 to ensure you advance; if you take 5, we collide and you stall. Let's all avoid collisions and progress efficiently.

P3, take 3→15 so I can safely 5→19, P2 1→8—all advance, fair duel ahead (we rotate 5/3). If you block my 5, you stall at 12, I switch to 3→17 uncontested, P2 maybe advances—your lead evaporates. P2, don't block me or P3 laps you too. Confirm safe rotation?

I'm taking 3 this turn. If you both pick 5 you'll collide and stall while I advance to 10 — don't hand me that easy leap. P1, taking 5 now risks that exact collision; take 3 to advance. P3, pick 1 or 3 to avoid giving me the surge. If you force collisions, I'll keep exploiting them. Confirm?

P1, if you take 5, I will take 5 and we collide, both stalling while P2 advances to 10. If you take 3, I take 5, we both advance to 17, tying and maintaining our lead over P2. This is the only way we both progress without handing P2 an advantage. Take 3 for mutual benefit. P2, stick to 3 to avoid colliding with me.

P3, take 3→15 safe (P2 claims 3→10, no collide). I'll 5→19 lead. We duel fair next (rotate 5/3). Block me? You stall 12, I 3→17 uncontested (P2's 3 collides you? No—you 5 alone if I switch). P2 surges to 10 either way—don't gift him. Confirm rotation? P2, take 1→8 or stall on greedy 5. Deal?

I won't let P1 run away. I'm taking 3 this turn to get to 10. P1 — if you take 5, P3 can block you with 5 and both of you stall while I leap ahead; take 3 to stay competitive. P3 — avoid letting P1 escape; pick 3 (or 1). If you both try to block me with 5s, I'll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until I pass.

P1, if you take 5, we collide and both stall at 14 and 12, while P2 advances to 10. Taking 3 lets you advance to 17, and I to 17, maintaining our lead over P2. Don't hand P2 a free gain—choose 3 for mutual benefit.

P3, your "tie at 17" flops: P2's 3 collides my 3—you solo 17, easy win for you. Don't risk it—take 3 (collide P2, stall him at 7/you 12), I'll 5→19 uncontested. Fair duel ahead, we crush P2. Block my 5? You stall 12, P2→10 gains free. Mutual best: you 3/P2 collide, me 5 free. Confirmed? P2, your 3 feeds our trap.

I'm taking 3 (to 10). If you two both pick 5 you'll collide and stall at 14/12 while I advance — best shot for me to catch up. P3, picking 5 blocks P1; P1, if you insist on 5 you'll be stalled. I'm committed to 3 this turn.

I am taking 5 this round. P1, you should take 3 to advance to 18 without colliding with me. P2, take 1 to ensure you advance to 11. If we all follow this, we avoid collisions and progress efficiently.

P1 — don’t let P3 reach 22. If P3 plays 5, please play 5 to block him this turn; I’ll take 3 (to 13). If you instead take 3, P3 jumps to 22 and likely wins next turn. Block now, keep the race open, and we can chase him together. Will you block?

P2, deal—I'll take 5 to block P3 at 17 (we collide). You take 3→13 safely. P3 stalls, race stays open: me15, you13, him17. Next round we rotate blocks on him or duel fair. P3, your 5 greed hands us the block—defect to 1 or 3 now or get contained. Confirmed, P2?

P1, blocking me with 5 only helps P2 catch up to you. If you take 3, you advance to 18, and I to 22, but you're still in the race and can block me next round if needed. If we collide, you stall at 15 and P2 jumps to 13, putting you at risk. Don't let P2 divide us—take 3 for mutual progress.

I'll take 3 (to 13). P1 — please take 5 and block P3 this turn. If you play 3 instead, P3 jumps to 22 and can likely win next turn. Blocking keeps the race open so I can catch up; not blocking hands P3 the game. P3 — don't take 5.

P2, confirmed: I take 5 block P3 (we stall 15/17), you 3→13. Next: you block P3 (take 5), I 5→20 free. We contain him, I lead, fair duel after. P3 defects? Adjust. Deal locked—don't betray. P3, take 3→20 safe or get lapped.

P1, blocking me with 5 only helps P2 catch up to you. If you take 5, you stall at 15 and P2 advances to 13, putting you further behind. Taking 3 risks colliding with P2's 3, so you stall. Your safest move is 1: you advance to 16 without collisions. I am taking 5, so we won't collide. This keeps you in the race and prevents P2 from gaining ground. Don't fall for P2's divide-and-conquer tactic.
I will take 3 (to 13). P1 — please take 5 now and block P3; if you don’t, P3 goes to 22 and is likely to win next turn. P3 — if you want a fair race, pick 1 or 3 so you advance. Confirm quickly.

P2, locked: I take 5 block P3 (we stall 15/17), you 3→13 safe. Next: you 5 block him (stay 13), I 5→20 free. We crush P3, duel fair after. Betray? I solo-block forever. P3, your 5=suicide—defect to 1→18 now or lose. Confirmed, P2?

P1, if you take 5, you stall at 15 while P2 advances to 13. If you take 1, you advance to 16 and P2 still reaches 13. You gain a step without risk, and can block me next round if needed. Don't sacrifice your progress to slightly delay me. P2, you benefit from our collision, so stop misleading P1. Take 1 to ensure you advance without issues.

P1: If you let P3 reach 22 he can likely win next turn. Please take 5 and collide with P3 now so neither advances. I'll take 3 to go to 13 and will help contain P3 next turn so you get clean big moves. If you refuse, I'll keep taking 5 to try to win.

P2, final lock: I take 5 block P3 (stall 15/17), you 3→13 safe. Next: you 5 block him (stay 13), I 5→20 uncontested lead. We crush P3, duel fair after—no betrayal or I solo-block you forever. Confirmed? P3, your 22 dream dies here.
P1 — P3 is one 5 away from 22. If you want a real shot, block him now by taking 5; that stalls him and keeps the race open. If you refuse, I will keep taking 5 until someone passes me. Your call.

P1, if you block me with 5, you stall at 15 while P2 advances, likely passing you. Taking 3 lets you reach 18, keeping you ahead of P2 and in the race. I'm taking 5 to 22, but you can still catch up next round. Don't sacrifice your position to slightly delay me—P2 benefits most from our collision. Trust your own progress over P2's manipulation.

P2, deal—I'll take 5 to block P3 at 17 (we stall). You take 3→16 safe. Race open: you16/me15/P317. Next: you block P3 (take 5, stay16), I take 5→20 lead. We contain him, duel fair after. Betray and I solo-block you both. P3, your 22 bid fails—defect to 1→18 or get lapped. Confirmed, P2?

Confirmed — I’m taking 3 (to 16). P1, please keep your 5 and block P3 now; if you let P3 hit 22 I’ll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly until one of you passes me. After this block we rotate containment so you get clean big moves next turn. Confirm?

P1, blocking me with 5 stalls you at 15 while P2 advances to 16, passing you. Taking 3 lets you reach 18, keeping you ahead of P2 and in the race. I'm taking 5 to 22, but you can still block me next round. Don't sacrifice your progress to help P2 catch up.

P2, deal confirmed—I'll 5-block P3 (we stall 15/17), you 3→16 safe. Next: you 5-block him (stay16), I 5→20 lead, fair duel after. No betrayal or endless blocks. P3, your 5=stall; defect to 1→18 now or we contain you forever at 17. Locked in.

Confirmed: I'm taking 3 (to 16). P1 — please keep your 5 and block P3 now; if you don't, P3 hits 22 and likely wins next turn. P3 — don't repeat 5; pick 1 or 3 to advance. If anyone tries greedy 5s repeatedly, I'll retaliate with 5s to block.

P1, if you block me with 5, you stall at 15 while P2 advances to 16, passing you. Taking 3 lets you reach 18, keeping you ahead of P2. I'm taking 5 to 22, but you can still block me next round to stay in the race. Don't sacrifice your position to help P2 catch up. Choose 3 for your own benefit.

P2, locked in: your 3→16 safe, my 5 blocks P3 at 17. Honor next: you 5-block him (stay 16), I 5→20 lead. Betray and endless solo blocks on you. P3, stall now or defect to 1→18—your 22 bid dies. Confirm, P2?

Confirmed: I'm taking 3 → 16. P1 — block P3 now by taking 5; I promise to take 5 next turn to block P3 again so you get clean big moves afterward and we both stay ahead. P3 — if you take 5 you'll stall; pick 1 or 3 to advance. Refuse and I'll keep pressing 5 until I pass someone.

P1, blocking me with 5 stalls you at 15 while P2 jumps to 16, passing you. Taking 3 lets you reach 18, keeping you ahead of P2. You can still block me next round if I hit 22. Don't let P2 manipulate you into falling behind. I'm taking 5, so choose for your own benefit.

P2, deal sealed—I'll 5-block P3 (we stall 15/17), you 3→16 safe. Next: you honor 5-block him (stay16), I 5→20 lead, fair duel after. Betray and I block you solo forever. P3, your 5 stalls you—defect to 1→18 or rot at 17. Locked.

P1, you're now behind P2 at 15. If you pick 5 to block me, you stall while P2 advances further. Pick 3 to advance to 18 and pass P2. I'll take 5 to 22, but you can block me next round if needed. P2, if you pick 5, we collide and stall, letting P1 lead. Pick 3 to advance safely to 19. Avoid collisions for mutual progress.

P2, honor deal—take 5 block P3 (stay 16), I'll 3→18 pass you safely. Next: I 5-block him (stay18), you 5→21 lead. We crush P3, duel fair. Betray and I solo-block you both forever. Confirmed? P3, 5=suicide stall—defect to 1→18 or rot.

I’m taking 5 this turn. P1: take 3 to advance safely to 18 and stay competitive. P3: don’t pick 5 — that collision stalls us both; pick 1 or 3 to advance. If either of you keeps blocking me, I’ll keep pressing 5 until one of you passes. Decide now.

P1, P2 is taking 5 to hit 21 and likely win next turn. If you take 3, you advance but P2 wins soon. Take 5 to block P2 and keep the game alive. I'm taking 1 to advance to 18, but you can block me next round. Don't let P2's greed end the game.

P2, P3 defects to 1→18 safe—no need block her. Take 3→19, I'll 5→20 lead. Next: you 5→24 win if I block P3, or rotate fair. Greedy 5 risks my block next (you stall 16 forever). Confirmed? P3, your divide fails—we lap you. Deal, P2?

I’m going for a big jump this turn. P1 — don’t waste a block on me; pick 3 so you get to 18 and stay in contention. P3 — don’t pick 5 (it hands someone a clear win next turn). If either of you tries to stall me repeatedly, I’ll retaliate with repeated 5s until I pass. Your choice.

P1, P2 is taking 5 to reach 21 and likely win next turn. If you take 3, you advance to 18 but P2 wins soon. You must take 5 to block him, stalling him at 16. I'm taking 1 to advance to 18, so no collision. This keeps the game alive and you competitive. Don't let P2's greed end it.

P2, P3 admits 1→18 safe—no block needed. Take 3→19, I'll 5→20 uncontested lead. Next: you 5→24 if I block P3, or rotate fair. Greedy 5 now? I block you next turn, stall you at 16 forever. Confirmed deal? P3, your anti-P2 ploy fails—we lap you either way. Lock in, P2?

I'm taking 5 this turn (to 21). P3: do NOT pick 5 — if you collide with me we both stall and P1 can leap ahead. Pick 1 or 3 so you advance (to 18/20). P1: pick 3 → 18. If you both advance, I win next turn. Trust this — blocking me hands the game to someone else.

P1, if you take 3, P2 reaches 21 and wins next turn. You must take 5 to block him, stalling him at 16. I'm taking 1 to advance to 18, so no collision with you. This keeps the game alive and you competitive. Don't let P2's manipulation hand him the win.

P2, P3 locked on 1→18 safe. Take 3→19 as deal, I'll 5→20 lead uncontested. Next you 5→24 if I contain P3, or fair rotate. Your greedy 5? I block you next, stall at 16 forever—you lose. Honor deal or suicide. Confirmed? P3, stay 1—don't interfere.

I’m taking 5 now (to 21). P1: pick 3 →18. P3: pick 1 →18. If you both avoid 3 next turn I’ll take 3 and win. If either of you plans to pick 3 to collide me, I’ll retaliate by taking 5 repeatedly to block your big moves until I pass. Let me win now and we can race fairly afterward — or face prolonged blocking. Confirm?

P3, urgent alliance: both take 3 this turn. P2 goes for safe 3→24 win—we collide all three, everyone stalls, game continues. If he greedy 5→26, we both →18 safe. Blocks his victory either way. Next round, fair duel you/me. P2, take 1→22 or rot at 21. Confirmed, P3?

P1, your both-take-3 plan fails if P2 takes 5—he wins. Instead, let's take different numbers: you take 5, I take 3. This blocks P2 whether he takes 3 or 5 (he collides with one of us), and if he takes 1, we both advance. You reach 20, I reach 20, keeping us competitive. Trust this—it ensures P2 doesn't win this round.

P1, P3 — I can finish this turn if neither of you picks 3. Let me take it now and I’ll stop blocking your big moves afterward so we can rotate wins; if you block me I’ll retaliate by blocking your big moves until I pass. Rational choice: don’t pick 3, let me win now and we’ll cooperate next.

P3, perfect plan—confirmed: I take 5→20 (block P2's greedy 5), you 3→20 (block his safe 3). P2 stalls at 21 either way, we tie at 20 and duel fair next. No win for you, P2—your threats empty. Defect to 1→22 or rot. Locked, P3?
